institutionCode.label: Institution
institutionCode.error: name or acronym of institution is required

AgeClass.description: The age class of the organism at the time of collection.
AgeClass.label: Age Class

broad_scale_environmental_context.description: Report the major environmental system the sample or specimen came from. The system(s) identified should have a coarse spatial grain, to provide the general environmental context of where the sampling was done (e.g. in the desert or a rainforest). We recommend using subclasses of EnvO’s biome class: http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000428. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.

local_scale_environmental_context.description: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling. We recommend using subclasses of 'environmental material' (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483). EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS . Terms from other OBO ontologies are permissible as long as they reference mass/volume nouns (e.g. air, water, blood) and not discrete, countable entities (e.g. a tree, a leaf, a table top).

environmental_medium.description: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling. We recommend using subclasses of 'environmental material' (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483). EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS . Terms from other OBO ontologies are permissible as long as they reference mass/volume nouns (e.g. air, water, blood) and not discrete, countable entities (e.g. a tree, a leaf, a table top).

enrichment_markers.description: Description of the specificity markers used to isolate cell populations e.g. 'CD45+'

isolation_kit.description: The kit used to isolate the cells.

amplification_method.description: The method used to amplify the cDNA, e.g. "PCR".

library_construction_method.description:
The library construction method (including version) that
was used, e.g. "Smart-Seq2", "Drop-Seq", "10X v3".

input_molecule.description:
The specific fraction of biological macromolecule from
which the sequencing library is derived, e.g. "polyA
RNA".

amplification_method.description: The method used to amplify the cDNA, e.g. "PCR".

library_construction_method.description:
The library construction method (including version) that
was used, e.g. "Smart-Seq2", "Drop-Seq", "10X v3".

input_molecule.description:
The specific fraction of biological macromolecule from
which the sequencing library is derived, e.g. "polyA
RNA".

primer.description:
The type of primer used for reverse transcription, e.g.
"oligo-dT" or "random" primer. This allows users to
identify content of the cDNA library input, e.g. enriched
for mRNA.

end_bias.description: The end bias of the library, e.g. "5'" or "3'".

library_strand.description:
The strand from which the library was derived, e.g.
"unstranded", "sense", "antisense".

spike_in.description:
Spike-in RNAs are RNA molecules with known
sequence that are added to the cell lysis mix. E.g. the
External RNA Controls Consortium (ERCC) spike in set
is commonly used in scRNA-seq experiments.

spike_in_dilution_or_concentration.description:
The final concentration or dilution (for commercial sets)
of the spike in mix, e.g. "1:40,000"

technical_replicate_group_or_library_ref.description:
A common term for all runs/files belonging to the same
cell or library. We suggest to use a stable sample
accession from a biosample archive like BioSamples
database6. Alternatively, the library ID can be
referenced from which the files were generated.

A common term for all runs/files belonging to the same
cell or library. We suggest to use a stable sample
accession from a biosample archive like BioSamples
database6. Alternatively, the library ID can be
referenced from which the files were generated.

UMI_barcode_read.description:
The type of read that contains the UMI barcode:
index1/index2/read1/read2.

UMI_barcode_offset.description:
The offset in sequence of the UMI identifying barcode.
E.g. "16"

UMI_barcode_size.description: The size of the UMI identifying barcode. E.g. "10".

cell_barcode_read.description:
The type of read that contains the UMI barcode:
index1/index2/read1/read2.

cell_barcode_offset.description:
The offset in sequence of the cell identifying barcode.
E.g. "0".

cell_barcode_size.description:
The offset in sequence of the cell identifying barcode.
E.g. "0".

cDNA_read.description:
The type of read that contains the cDNA read:
index1/index2/read1/read2.

cDNA_read_offset.description:
The type of read that contains the cDNA read:
index1/index2/read1/read2.

The type of read that contains the cDNA read:
index1/index2/read1/read2.

cDNA_read_size.description: The size of the cDNA read. E.g. "100".

sample_barcode_read.description:
The type of read that contains the sample barcode:
index1/index2/read1/read2

sample_barcode_offset.description:
The offset in sequence of the sample identifying
barcode. E.g. "0".

sample_barcode_size.description:
The type of read that contains the sample barcode:
index1/index2/read1/read2

library_preparation_reference.description:
The name of the file that contains the library preparation
information. E.g. "File1_LibraryPrep.json".

sequencing_reference.description:
The name of the file that contains the sequencing
information. E.g. "File1_Sequencing.json".

read_1_file.description:
The name of the file that contains read 1. E.g.
"File1_R1.fastq.gz".

read_2_file.description:
The name of the file that contains read 2. E.g.
"File1_R2.fastq.gz".

index_1_file.description:
The name of the file that contains index read 1. E.g.
"File1_I1.fastq.gz".

index_2_file.description:
The name of the file that contains index read 1. E.g.
"File1_I2.fastq.gz".

checksum.description:
Result of a hash function calculated on the file content
to assert file integrity. Commonly used algorithms are
MD5 and SHA-1. E.g.
"ab21a9c0f2007890fe2fbe48df0519f9".

white_list_barcode_file.description:
A file containing the known cell barcodes in the
dataset.

file_derived_from.description:
The name of the file that was used to generate the
analysis derived data. E.g. "File1_Sequencing.json".

inferred_cell_type.label: inferred_cell_type
inferred_cell_type.description:
Post analysis cell type or identity declaration based on
expression profile or known gene function identified by
the performer, e.g. if a pool of cells are sequenced with
the purpose of identifying new cell types or sub-
populations. Per cell, in addition to sample of origin
metadata, lineage, class, and subclass attributes that
serve to group cells within the sample or set of
samples can be declared. E.g. "type II bipolar neuron".

post_analysis_cell_well_quality.label: post_analysis_cell_well_quality
post_analysis_cell_well_quality.description:
Performer defined measure of whether the read output
from the cell was included in the sequencing analysis.
For example, cells might be excluded if a threshold
percentage of reads did not map to the genome or if
pre-sequencing quality measures were not passed.
E.g. "pass" or "fail".

other_derived_cell_attributes.label: other_derived_cell_attributes
other_derived_cell_attributes.description:
Any other cell level measurement or annotation as
result of the analysis. E.g. cluster, gene count, UMI
count, tSNE coordinates.
